data.title: A NSA employee was able to secretly intercept the phone calls of nine women for six years without ever being detected by his managers, the agency's internal watchdog has revealed.
In India, the Supreme Court has ruled that a None-of-the-Above button must be included on electronic voting machines, allowing people to cast votes of no confidence in all candidates.
'It is time to end the war on drugs', says top UK police chief
Mom who held down 4-year-old son so step-father could rape him gets 20 years
28 killed, hundred injured by swarms of giant hornets in China
Drug Is Found to Eradicate HIV Permanently from Infected Cells

Iranian President Hassan Rouhani returns to Tehran, and is greeted by 200-300 supporters offering thanks for his conciliatory overtures to the West, while about 60 hard-liners chanted 'Death to America' and hurled shoes and eggs at his convoy.
McCain hires controversial Syria analyst who works as paid consultant to Syrian rebel group and lied about having a PhD from Georgetown.
Greek police arrest Golden Dawn Party leader and a party lawmaker
